functions.footprints.prediction¶

Module Contents¶

functions.footprints.prediction.load_model(model_path, weights_path)¶

Load Keras model and weights from disk.

functions.footprints.prediction.load_models(model_paths)¶

Load list of Keras models and weights from disk.

functions.footprints.prediction.learn_distribution(path, count)¶

Learn distribution of imagery by sampling subset.

functions.footprints.prediction.predict_sample(img, mean, std, model)¶

Standardize image with featurewise mean and standard deviation then make prediction with model.

Parameters

  • img (np.ndarray) – Input image to model.

  • mean (np.ndarray) – The feature-wise mean used to center img.

  • std (np.ndarray) – The feature-wise standard deviation used to scale img.

  • model (tf.keras.Model) – Keras model used for predictions.

Returns

Model prediction.

Return type

np.ndarray

functions.footprints.prediction.estimate_footprints(roi, survey, img_dir, model_dirs, context_sizes, n_samples=1000)¶

Estimate footprints using specified models for roi across survey tiles and surrounding context area, and save to disk.

Parameters

  • roi (str) – The roi to predict over, used for writing to disk.

  • survey (np.ndarray) – The survey whose tiles to predict on.

  • img_dir (str) – The path to the directory containing tiles.

  • model_dirs (list of str) – The list of paths to models used for prediction.

  • context_sizes (list of int) – The list of context sizes to predict on around survey tiles.

  • n_samples (int, optional) – The number of samples to use to sample featurewise mean and standard deviation.

Returns

None.

functions.footprints.prediction.estimate_footprints_full(roi, survey, img_dir, model_dirs, context_sizes, n_samples=1000)¶

Estimate footprints for entire roi using specified model, and save to disk.

Parameters

  • roi (str) – The roi to predict over, used for writing to disk.

  • survey (np.ndarray) – The survey whose bounds to predict over.

  • img_dir (str) – The path to the directory containing tiles.

  • model_dirs (str) – Path to the model used for prediction.

  • context_sizes (list of int) – The list of context sizes to predict on around survey tiles.

  • n_samples (int, optional) – The number of samples to use to sample featurewise mean and standard deviation.

Returns

None.

functions.footprints.prediction.run_footprints(params)¶

Execute estimate_footprints with parameters from params dict.
